title: Introduction to the symposium from the technical committee
segmentation: Good morning, I would like to on behalf of the Pipe Committee 4.2 which is the former World Rd Association Committee on Surface characteristic to welcome you here to Port Rose in Slovenia.
Surf events has become a tradition.
As a final and closing event for four year cycle, but it also marks the beginning of a new cycle and that cycle has already started.
It actually started in April this year and the new committee will be chaired by Doctor Francesca Latora.
Francesca, I wish you a good success in the coming four years with your work.
Good success with that.
I would also like to acknowledge the work that has been done for preparing this imposter.
When we started talking about.
Where to put away to host it.
Slovenia kindly offered to host this six composure here in portables.
And a very grateful for this Slovenia Rd agency and the Slovenian Park National Committee to take that offer.
You have done a tremendous work to get us where we are today, and I'm pretty sure that all the good effort will also resolved in that we have a very fruitful and beneficial conference.
Specifically also to the organizing committee with Boy in Lebanon and his team, I think that you have done an excellent work.
And as Michelle said, that by the worst of Sean Francois Coty, that the scientific committee within the TC 4.2 has done an excellent work shared by metric on doing as we said earlier.
Unfortunately, Matthew cannot be here.
I'm very sorry for that because I felt that he should have.
Having the opportunity also to see the outcome of his excellent work.
We still have challenges today and still have plenty of work to do.
Environmental issues certainly gives an impact on when we're looking at surface characteristics.
Powerful rain and so on can change the surface characteristic dramatically, or at least what the root user experience when we're talking about the surface characteristics.
Safety is an issue we have tackled for many years and will still be doing that.
A lot of work has been done with friction and.
Some properties working with the International friction, indexes and so on, and there's still plenty of work to do.
Noise has been an issue within the last five or ten years I think, and Steve representing some of the things that have been done in Europe.
There's been tremendous pick research projects in Europe, and I guess that you will hear results from those research projects within the next two or three days.
Then there is the air pollution.
The CO2 problem that we encounter.
I actually read in the Danish newspaper this morning that detainees state will be put to court becausw environmental groups have found out that about 600 people in Denmark die of air pollution.
It's about the same amount as die in traffic and traffic accidents.
So for sure there will be a lot of focus on that in the future to come.
And we can see that we already is beginning to work with rolling resistant, proper problems and so on, which is related to the surface.
So I guess that there will be a lot of focus on that in the coming years.
Implementing new contractor concept is something that is coming more and more.
We see it for sure.
In Denmark, municipalities is doing a lot to make contracts with the contractors for 15 year period of maintenance.

One of the problem is for municipalities and I think I can say that without hurting anyone is that they don't really know much about surface characteristics, but they want to have them in the contract as control parameters.
They want to have them in to see what is the level we want.
What is the quality of the rope we want after these 15 years.
So we're doing a lot of work at the moment trying to tailor in surface characteristics as part of contractual concepts within.
I'm going to predators, states or whatever with the contractor.
Private public partnership is something we have heard for several years as well.
It has been mentioned at World Rd Congress is that it is something that we need to work more with.
And again, there.
To justify or to quantify the quality of the roads is something that has an important and that is where surface characteristics come in.
Development in vehicle fleet.
When I put that on this slide when I was preparing, I said OK in Denmark we're going up to 25 metre trucks in Australia.
I think they have even longer one so even bigger ones.
But anyhow, we have to tackle that as well.

I put this table just to show you that when you introduce new types of trucks, you also introduce new parameters that you have to take into account longer stopping distances, heavier loads and so on, or problems that influences the way that we have to.
Maintain an construct our roads, so for sure we have a lot of work.
Also there in the future.
Traffic speed versus stopping distance.
It became a problem in Denmark or not a problem.
A challenge, I would say, because suddenly politically we were allowed to do 130 kilometres an hour on the freeway is compared to the 110 we have done for many years.

And the first slide I actually showed you is a slide from a campaign in Denmark where the Council of Traffic Safety is now putting up signs along the road, asking people to reduce their speed by 10 kilometers an hour, because we see that there is a risk or higher risk for traffic accidents.

Putting higher demand so higher requirements for traffic speeds at all also give us a challenge of how we do and how we monitor and control our payments in order to make them sure in order to make the road users giving the best ability to stop their vehicles.
So there is still.
Many, many things to do.
Protecting the road network assets is of course also asset management is something that is failing you.
We started up with payment management related to the payment structure.
Now we're not only looking at the payment, but we are looking at the assets of a whole Rd network.
And there again, the road surface characteristics come in to play an important role when you have to determine Rd user cost etc.
So there many things needs to be tailored into what we can account are within the measuring possibilities we have.
And you can probably recognize where I am on this picture.
As set this mark the the final of the last four years when we initiated the TC 4.2 some 4 five years ago we were given a challenge.
Terms of references to work with.
I think that for the majority of what we have done an accomplished over the last four years.
We have done very well.

There's a lot of publications that you can get and retrieve from the park website, and I hope that the terms of reference that were set for us reflects in to the program that we set for this surf 2008.
So by this I just have to wish you all a very pleasant, fruitful stay here in the beautiful portoroz.
And I hope that you will have a good time too.
Ask good questions and.
Just have a good time, thank you.
